title: MURDER OF THE UNIVERSE
content:

[[include :scp-wiki:theme:skipos]]

=====
[[include component:preview
text=
I am the weather, I am the sun's heat. I am the night sky.
]]
=====

[[=]]
[[module rate]]
[[/=]]
@@ @@
[[div class="skip_box terminal"]]
[[size larger]] “The oldest and strongest emotion of mankind is fear, and the oldest and strongest kind of fear is fear of the unknown” [[/size]]
[[size smaller]]- H. P. Lovecraft[[/size]]
[[/div]]
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
[[=]]
[[=image http://scp-sandbox-3.wikidot.com/local--files/collab:cthulhu-hub/murderoftheuniverse.png]]
A series dedicated to my friend [[*user cubeflix]].
[[/=]]
@@ @@
[[div class="skip_box terminal"]]
Cthulhu is often reduced to a "big scary squid man," but the reality is far more complex.

First and foremost, Cthulhu is a god. And gods do not exist within the same dimensions as we do. They are vast, unfathomable, and beyond the limits of our perception. To imagine one constrained to the third dimension, like any ordinary being, is a fundamental misunderstanding of how they work.

Think of it this way. You exist in 3 dimensions. You cast a 2 dimensional shadow. The same principle applies in higher dimensions. A four-dimensional entity would cast a three-dimensional shadow. That shadow is not the entity itself, merely a distorted sign of it's true form.

Cthulhu, then, is not simply an entity. He is a force—neither good nor evil, but something so vast and alien that our minds struggle to comprehend it.

Which brings us to the reason you’re here. The files below detail various splinter groups drawn to this force, like flies to a corpse, the shadow of Cthulhu looming.
[[/div]]
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
